Rich,

I'm thinking about the XnView.  What do I do to reduce file size? Convert jpg to some other format?

Dean
Dr. Dean S. Hartley III
Hartley Consulting

106 Windsong Ln
Oak Ridge, TN 37830

(865) 425-9752
DSHartley3@... 
http://DSHartley3.home.comcast.net

  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Richard Turner 
  To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: 09/12/2010 9:42 PM
  Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Re: Photos from 1964 Sword Show


    
  Hi Dean, no mate, there are smart ways to reduce the file size of the 
  photos without compromising size or quality. Apps such as Photoshop 
  excel at this and also XnView which is free is a very good option. I 
  work in Film and Television so this is something I am quite experienced 
  in (as is Jim G our fearless leader)

  I think there would be a good interest in the US and a lesser 
  international interest though selling any form of book to the younger 
  generation seems a daunting task. What do they need books for, they have 
  the internet.

  Rich

  On 13/09/2010 8:13 AM, Dean wrote:
  >
  > Richard,
  >
  > I presume you are suggesting downgrading the jpg photos to smaller 
  > sizes. I can do that; however, it does reduce the quality of detail. 
  > Do you not have highspeed internet?
  >
  > I am thinking about reproducing the catalog, complete with Dad's notes 
  > and adding pages of the show pictures. Do you think there is a market 
  > for a paper copy (~$40)?
  >
  > Dean
  >
  > --- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com 
  > <mailto:nihontostudy%40yahoogroups.com>, Richard Turner <ikkanshi@...> 
  > wrote:
  > >
  > >
  > > Hi Dean, yes I agree, it's a brilliant job. One thing I would 
  > suggest is
  > > getting a little smarter with your photos as the page takes a long time
  > > to load. I down loaded one photo and it is 2.3 meg. Given that there 
  > are
  > > many images there it will slow down the loading considerably and also
  > > eat into peoples bandwith depending on their connection speeds.
  > >
  > > There are some easy ways to alleviate this and if you would like to
  > > discuss them please just let me know. I would be happy to help you.
  > >
